snippet: The White House is considering putting off a Senate vote on Dr. Vivek H. Murthy, who has come under criticism from the National Rifle Association, or withdrawing the nomination altogether.
abstract: White House considers delaying confirmation vote on Dr Vivek H Murthy, Pres Obama's nominee for surgeon general, or withdrawing nomination altogether as opposition mounts in the Senate; Murthy has come under intense criticism from the National Rifle Association and other gun-rights groups, placing Democrats in conservative states in difficult position ahead of midterm elections.
lead_paragraph: The White House is considering putting off a Senate vote on Dr. Vivek H. Murthy, who has come under criticism from the National Rifle Association, or withdrawing the nomination altogether.

headline.main: Senate Balks at Obama Pick for Surgeon General
headline.print_headline: Senate Balks at Obama Pick for Health Post
